Act of Heroism.flavor: "On every plane, there are those who run toward danger." —Gideon Jura
Act of Heroism.name: Act of Heroism
Act of Heroism.text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+2 until end of turn and can block an additional creature this turn.

Adorned Pouncer.name: Adorned Pouncer
Adorned Pouncer.text:
Double strike
Eternalize {3}{W}{W} ({3}{W}{W}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it, except it's a 4/4 black Zombie Cat with no mana cost. Eternalize only as a sorcery.)

Angel of Condemnation.name: Angel of Condemnation
Angel of Condemnation.text:
Flying, vigilance
{2}{W}, {T}: Exile another target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
{2}{W}, {T}, Exert Angel of Condemnation: Exile another target creature until Angel of Condemnation leaves the battlefield. (An exerted creature won't untap during your next untap step.)

Angel of the God-Pharaoh.flavor: The angels did not deceive. From the start, they were clear their allegiance was to the God-Pharaoh and to him alone.
Angel of the God-Pharaoh.name: Angel of the God-Pharaoh
Angel of the God-Pharaoh.text:
Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

Aven of Enduring Hope.flavor: "This storm will calm. We must believe that."
Aven of Enduring Hope.name: Aven of Enduring Hope
Aven of Enduring Hope.text:
Flying
When Aven of Enduring Hope enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

Crested Sunmare.flavor: "It is evidence that some pure corner of the world must still exist." —Djeru, former Tah-crop initiate
Crested Sunmare.name: Crested Sunmare
Crested Sunmare.text:
Other Horses you control have indestructible.
At the beginning of each end step, if you gained life this turn, create a 5/5 white Horse creature token.

Dauntless Aven.flavor: In the chaos brought by the new gods, swift-winged aven served as pathfinders, leading the last of the people away from the ruins of Naktamun.
Dauntless Aven.name: Dauntless Aven
Dauntless Aven.text:
Flying
Whenever Dauntless Aven attacks, untap target creature you control.

Desert's Hold.name: Desert's Hold
Desert's Hold.text:
Enchant creature
When Desert's Hold enters the battlefield, if you control a Desert or there is a Desert card in your graveyard, you gain 3 life.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.

Disposal Mummy.flavor: Without the viziers to oversee their actions, some anointed went to extreme lengths to fulfill their directives.
Disposal Mummy.name: Disposal Mummy
Disposal Mummy.text: When Disposal Mummy enters the battlefield, exile target card from an opponent's graveyard.

Djeru, With Eyes Open.name: Djeru, With Eyes Open
Djeru, With Eyes Open.text:
Vigilance
When Djeru, With Eyes Open enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a planeswalker card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
If a source would deal damage to a planeswalker you control, prevent 1 of that damage.

Djeru's Renunciation.flavor: "I was promised an afterlife, not this. Samut was right. The God-Pharaoh lied." —Djeru, former Tah-crop initiate
Djeru's Renunciation.name: Djeru's Renunciation
Djeru's Renunciation.text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Cycling {W} ({W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

Dutiful Servants.flavor: Buildings crumbled and monuments fell. The river bled and the sky wept tears of fire. All the while, servants silently continued their work, oblivious to it all.
Dutiful Servants.name: Dutiful Servants

Gideon's Defeat.flavor: "Gideon, how easy it must be to play the protector when you think yourself untouchable. How wrong you are." —Nicol Bolas
Gideon's Defeat.name: Gideon's Defeat
Gideon's Defeat.text: Exile target white creature that's attacking or blocking. If it was a Gideon planeswalker, you gain 5 life.

God-Pharaoh's Faithful.flavor: "This is the final trial! Rejoice, for the God-Pharaoh soars among us!"
God-Pharaoh's Faithful.name: God-Pharaoh's Faithful
God-Pharaoh's Faithful.text: Whenever you cast a blue, black, or red spell, you gain 1 life.

Hour of Revelation.flavor: In the first moments, the gate to the afterlife opened, and the people were prostrate in the light of the God-Pharaoh.
Hour of Revelation.name: Hour of Revelation
Hour of Revelation.text:
This spell costs {3} less to cast if there are ten or more nonland permanents on the battlefield.
Destroy all nonland permanents.

Mummy Paramount.flavor: "It appears some mummies have begun to observe a hierarchy all their own." —Elekh, vizier of embalming
Mummy Paramount.name: Mummy Paramount
Mummy Paramount.text: Whenever another Zombie enters the battlefield under your control, Mummy Paramount gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Oketra's Avenger.flavor: "Oketra's arrow is my spear, and her love my shield."
Oketra's Avenger.name: Oketra's Avenger
Oketra's Avenger.text: You may exert Oketra's Avenger as it attacks. When you do, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to it this turn. (An exerted creature won't untap during your next untap step.)

Oketra's Last Mercy.flavor: To the end, all Oketra did was for others.
Oketra's Last Mercy.name: Oketra's Last Mercy
Oketra's Last Mercy.text: Your life total becomes equal to your starting life total. Lands you control don't untap during your next untap step.

Overwhelming Splendor.name: Overwhelming Splendor
Overwhelming Splendor.text:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.
Enchanted player can't activate abilities that aren't mana abilities or loyalty abilities.

Sandblast.flavor: The sands of Amonkhet can be as much a boon as a bane. It depends entirely on which way the wind blows.
Sandblast.name: Sandblast
Sandblast.text: Sandblast deals 5 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

Saving Grace.name: Saving Grace
Saving Grace.text:
Flash
Enchant creature you control
When Saving Grace enters the battlefield, all damage that would be dealt this turn to you and permanents you control is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+3.

Solemnity.flavor: The arrival of the God-Pharaoh marked a betrayal of both gods and mortals.
Solemnity.name: Solemnity
Solemnity.text:
Players can't get counters.
Counters can't be put on artifacts, creatures, enchantments, or lands.

Solitary Camel.name: Solitary Camel
Solitary Camel.text: Solitary Camel has lifelink as long as you control a Desert or there is a Desert card in your graveyard. (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

Steward of Solidarity.flavor: In the midst of disaster, heroic acts became almost ordinary, and ordinary warriors became heroes.

Aerial Guide.flavor: "Kefnet taught us to turn obstacles into advantages." —Neponem, vizier of Kefnet
Aerial Guide.name: Aerial Guide
Aerial Guide.text:
Flying
Whenever Aerial Guide attacks, another target attacking creature gains flying until end of turn.

Aven Reedstalker.flavor: "Our best chance against the Eternals will be tactics they've never seen and styles they've never trained in."

Countervailing Winds.flavor: The Eternals had long since mastered every technique taught during the trials.

Cunning Survivor.flavor: Initiates who had been through the Trial of Knowledge learned to see everything as pieces of a larger puzzle.
Cunning Survivor.name: Cunning Survivor
Cunning Survivor.text: Whenever you cycle or discard a card, Cunning Survivor gets +1/+0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

Eternal of Harsh Truths.flavor: "If creating the Eternals was Bolas's plan here, what is his plan for the Eternals?" —Jace Beleren
Eternal of Harsh Truths.name: Eternal of Harsh Truths
Eternal of Harsh Truths.text:
Afflict 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, defending player loses 2 life.)

Fraying Sanity.flavor: Those wound tightest are first to unravel.
Fraying Sanity.name: Fraying Sanity
Fraying Sanity.text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of each end step, enchanted player puts the top X cards of their library into their graveyard, where X is the number of cards put into that graveyard from anywhere this turn.

Hour of Eternity.flavor: To serve as an eternal is the afterlife granted to the worthy.

Hour of Eternity.text: Exile X target creature cards from your graveyard. For each card exiled this way, create a token that's a copy of that card, except it's a 4/4 black Zombie.

Imaginary Threats.flavor: Liliana always knew Jace's illusions would come in handy.

Jace's Defeat.flavor: "I had hoped for more from you, Jace. But I expected as much." —Nicol Bolas

Jace's Defeat.text: Counter target blue spell. If it was a Jace planeswalker spell, scry 2.

Kefnet's Last Word.flavor: In his final moments, Kefnet reached into the minds of those around him, desperate for logic within the consuming chaos.

Flash
Flying

Ominous Sphinx.flavor: The sphinxes began to speak only after the Second Sun aligned. They whispered dire warnings, though no one listened.

Ominous Sphinx.text:
Flying

Proven Combatant.text: Eternalize {4}{U}{U} ({4}{U}{U}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it, except it's a 4/4 black Zombie Human Warrior with no mana cost. Eternalize only as a sorcery.)

Seer of the Last Tomorrow.flavor: "The truth? It's been here all along. The Hours as we understood them are lies."

Striped Riverwinder.flavor: The denizens of the Luxa River woke angry on the currents of blood.

Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

• Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

Swarm Intelligence.flavor: The Locust God's children were numberless, relentlessly eating away every trace of the city's protection.
Swarm Intelligence.name: Swarm Intelligence
Swarm Intelligence.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

Tragic Lesson.flavor: Though Kefnet's followers feverishly searched his last words for some final riddle, they found only the gurgles of a dying god.

Flying

Whenever Unesh, Criosphinx Sovereign or another Sphinx enters the battlefield under your control, reveal the top four cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

Unquenchable Thirst.name: Unquenchable Thirst
Unquenchable Thirst.text:
Enchant creature
When Unquenchable Thirst enters the battlefield, if you control a Desert or there is a Desert card in your graveyard, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

Unsummon.flavor: Skills mastered by initiates are preserved within cartouches, so Eternals remain adept at their preferred combat styles.

Unsummon.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

Vizier of the Anointed.name: Vizier of the Anointed
Vizier of the Anointed.text:
When Vizier of the Anointed enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card with eternalize or embalm, put that card into your graveyard, then shuffle your library.
Whenever you activate an eternalize or embalm ability, draw a card.

Accursed Horde.text: {1}{B}: Target attacking Zombie gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. If its toughness is 0 or less, it's still put into its owner's graveyard.)

Ammit Eternal.text:

Apocalypse Demon.name: Apocalypse Demon
Apocalypse Demon.text:
Flying
Apocalypse Demon's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Apocalypse Demon unless you sacrifice another creature.

Banewhip Punisher.flavor: "If I die, it will not be alone."
Banewhip Punisher.name: Banewhip Punisher
Banewhip Punisher.text:

Bontu's Last Reckoning.flavor: To the last, Bontu wanted only to be first among the God-Pharaoh's subjects.

Bontu's Last Reckoning.text: Destroy all creatures. Lands you control don't untap during your next untap step.

Carrion Screecher.flavor: The banished have come home to roost.
Carrion Screecher.name: Carrion Screecher

Doomfall.flavor: "This place has outlived its usefulness." —Nicol Bolas

Doomfall.text:

• Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.

Menace
Whenever Dreamstealer deals combat damage to a player, that player discards that many cards.

Grisly Survivor.flavor: No cartouches to earn. No afterlife to enter. Only the glory of a well-struck blow and the growing pile of felled enemies at her feet.
Grisly Survivor.name: Grisly Survivor
Grisly Survivor.text: Whenever you cycle or discard a card, Grisly Survivor gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

Hour of Glory.flavor: The gods of the trials also faced the opportunity to prove themselves worthy.

Hour of Glory.text: Exile target creature. If that creature was a God, its controller reveals their hand and exiles all cards from it with the same name as that creature.

Khenra Eternal.flavor: For many years, servant mummies toiled in the mines to extract lazotep. The emergence of the Eternals revealed the sacred substance's true purpose.
Khenra Eternal.name: Khenra Eternal
Khenra Eternal.text: Afflict 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, defending player loses 1 life.)

Lethal Sting.flavor: Initiates once believed defeat was the worst fate possible—a sentiment they quickly abandoned.
Lethal Sting.name: Lethal Sting
Lethal Sting.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control.
Destroy target creature.

Liliana's Defeat.flavor: "All the power you have gathered for yourself, Liliana, I can take away." —Nicol Bolas
Liliana's Defeat.name: Liliana's Defeat
Liliana's Defeat.text: Destroy target black creature or black planeswalker. If that permanent was a Liliana planeswalker, her controller loses 3 life.

Lurching Rotbeast.flavor: The dead that swept across Naktamun came in all shapes and sizes.

Merciless Eternal.flavor: "My work here is complete. The people have done everything required of them." —Nicol Bolas

Vile Manifestation.flavor: The glyphs writhed and twisted, spewing out dark, vengeful magic.

Wretched Camel.flavor: Perfectly adapted to cross the wastes in life, they bring the wastes with them in death.

Abrade.flavor: The desert is a voracious beast, devouring both flesh and stone.

Blur of Blades.flavor: Samut battled her way through the hordes, shouting the names of those who'd died in her crop and those she hoped yet to save.

Burning-Fist Minotaur.flavor: "There is no afterlife. Not for me, and not for you. So think again before getting in my way."

Chandra's Defeat.flavor: "Fire? Is that your only trick, Chandra?" —Nicol Bolas

Chaos Maw.flavor: The food chain doesn't end at sandwurms.

Crash Through.flavor: "We have to get out of the city, Djeru. All of us! Gather as many as you can." —Samut, former Tah-crop initiate

Defiant Khenra.flavor: There were those who saw the death of the gods and the city's collapse as a final test of worth. Some believed it meant the God-Pharaoh had been killed. Only a few realized they had been deceived.

Firebrand Archer.flavor: A word of vengeance, and her arrows awaken in flame.

Frontline Devastator.flavor: The God-Pharaoh's benevolence concealed the factory he created to produce an army of Eternals.

Hour of Devastation.flavor: "Everything here exists or perishes at my whim. Including you, Gatewatch." —Nicol Bolas
Hour of Devastation.name: Hour of Devastation
Hour of Devastation.text: All creatures lose indestructible until end of turn. Hour of Devastation deals 5 damage to each creature and each non-Bolas planeswalker.

Imminent Doom.text:
Imminent Doom enters the battlefield with a doom counter on it.
Whenever you cast a spell with converted mana cost equal to the number of doom counters on Imminent Doom, Imminent Doom deals that much damage to any target. Then put a doom counter on Imminent Doom.

Inferno Jet.flavor: "When the whole world is crazy, it's important to find something you can rely on."

Inferno Jet deals 6 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.

Kindled Fury.flavor: The minotaur stared at the Eternal bearing down on him—the embodiment of deadly skill he had aspired to become.

Magmaroth.flavor: Sand into glass and flesh into ash—such are the markers of its domain.

Open Fire.flavor: Some khenra archers fashion their arrows with a personal touch.

Puncturing Blow.flavor: "Neither the false God-Pharaoh nor his bugs will decide our fate." —Samut, former Tah-crop initiate

Sand Strangler.flavor: The bombardment of sand disorients, chokes, and ultimately tenderizes its prey.

Thorned Moloch.flavor: Those who fled the destruction of the city stumbled into the territory of their prickly neighbors.

Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

Ambuscade.flavor: "Spent a lifetime learning from predators. Picked up a few tricks."
Ambuscade.name: Ambuscade
Ambuscade.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature an opponent controls.

Beneath the Sands.flavor: Though buried and muffled, nature's whisper still called to Nissa.

Feral Prowler.flavor: Once favored companions, many cats were left to fend for themselves.

Frilled Sandwalla.flavor: It basks atop the rubble of Rhonas's monument, which still pulses with latent power.

Gift of Strength.flavor: "What greater testament can there be to Rhonas's lessons?"

Harrier Naga.flavor: She trusts that the potent poisons of her darts will reach the enemy before the enemy reaches her.

Hope Tender.flavor: Some refused to leave their shattered homes, vowing to rebuild at any cost.

Hour of Promise.flavor: With the Hekma breached and its protection removed, the deserts swept in.

Life Goes On.flavor: "If you believe the God-Pharaoh tests you, charge with me to prove yourself. If you believe he betrayed us all, join with me to fight for tomorrow!" —Samut, former Tah-crop initiate
Life Goes On.name: Life Goes On
Life Goes On.text: You gain 4 life. If a creature died this turn, you gain 8 life instead.

Majestic Myriarch.name: Majestic Myriarch
Majestic Myriarch.text:
Majestic Myriarch's power and toughness are each equal to twice the number of creatures you control.
At the beginning of each combat, Majestic Myriarch gains flying until end of turn if you control a creature with flying. The same is true for first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, menace, reach, trample, and vigilance.

Nissa's Defeat.flavor: "The soul of this world is gone, Nissa, and I would gladly kill it again." —Nicol Bolas

Oasis Ritualist.flavor: "It's only the end if we allow it."

Brambleweft Behemoth.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

Nissa's Encouragement.name: Nissa's Encouragement
Nissa's Encouragement.text: Search your library and graveyard for a card named Forest, a card named Brambleweft Behemoth, and a card named Nissa, Genesis Mage. Reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Woodland Stream.flavor: "Bolas's power on this plane can't be absolute. Look around you." —Nissa Revane
Woodland Stream.name: Woodland Stream
Woodland Stream.text:
Woodland Stream enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.

Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver.name: Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver
Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver.text:
+3: Each opponent loses 3 life unless that player sacrifices a nonland permanent or discards a card.
−3: Destroy target creature. Draw a card.
−11: Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver deals 7 damage to each opponent. You draw seven cards.

Wasp of the Bitter End.flavor: As the Second Sun glided into its final position in the sky, a chorus of wings sounded to herald the return of Nicol Bolas.
Wasp of the Bitter End.name: Wasp of the Bitter End
Wasp of the Bitter End.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Bolas planeswalker spell, you may sacrifice Wasp of the Bitter End. If you do, destroy target creature.

Zealot of the God-Pharaoh.flavor: The God-Pharaoh's most devoted took it upon themselves to follow his example.
Zealot of the God-Pharaoh.name: Zealot of the God-Pharaoh
Zealot of the God-Pharaoh.text: {4}{R}: Zealot of the God-Pharaoh deals 2 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.

Visage of Bolas.name: Visage of Bolas
Visage of Bolas.text:
When Visage of Bolas enters the battlefield, you may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.
{T}: Add {U}, {B}, or {R}.

Cinder Barrens.flavor: "I do as I choose with what is mine. And it is all mine." —Nicol Bolas
Cinder Barrens.name: Cinder Barrens
Cinder Barrens.text:
Cinder Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.
